nodes.id: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国大使馆

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国大使馆
en: Embassy of The People's Republic of China in The United States of America

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国在美国设立的外交代表机构。
description.en: The diplomatic mission of the People's Republic of China to the United States.

description.zh-cn: 与美国于1979年建立外交关系。
description.en: Established diplomatic relations with the United States in 1979.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国大使馆的驻在国。
description.en: The host country of the Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States of America.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国外交官，现任中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国特命全权大使。
description.en: A diplomat of the People's Republic of China, currently serving as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the People's Republic of China to the United States of America.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国外交部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国外交部
en: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政府负责外交事务的组成部门，领导驻外外交机构。
description.en: The component department of the Government of the People's Republic of China responsible for foreign affairs, which leads diplomatic missions abroad.

description.zh-cn: 在美国与中华人民共和国建交前，其驻美大使馆为中国在美国的外交代表机构。
description.en: Before the United States established diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China, its embassy in the U.S. was the diplomatic mission of China in the United States.

description.zh-cn: 美国前总统，在其任内宣布与中华人民共和国建交。
description.en: Former President of the United States who announced the establishment of diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China during his term.

description.zh-cn: 一个从中华民国政府手中象征性购买原双橡园大使官邸的组织。
description.en: An organization that symbolically purchased the former Twin Oaks ambassadorial residence from the government of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 前中国副总理，其1979年的访美行程曾引发抗议。
description.en: Former Vice Premier of China, whose 1979 visit to the United States sparked protests.

description.zh-cn: 著名建筑师，设计了中华人民共和国驻美国大使馆新馆。
description.en: Renowned architect who designed the new building for the Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States.

description.zh-cn: 哥伦比亚特区议会议长，曾提案将中国驻美大使馆前的街道改名为“刘晓波路”。
description.en: Chairman of the Council of the District of Columbia who proposed renaming the street in front of the Chinese Embassy to 'Liu Xiaobo Road'.

description.zh-cn: 一项将中华人民共和国驻美国大使馆前街道改名的提议，旨在纪念异议人士刘晓波。
description.en: A proposal to rename the street in front of the Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States to commemorate dissident Liu Xiaobo.

description.zh-cn: 美国共和党参议员，曾提出将中国驻美大使馆门前地址命名为“刘晓波广场”的提案。
description.en: A U.S. Republican Senator who proposed naming the address in front of the Chinese Embassy in the U.S. as 'Liu Xiaobo Plaza'.

description.zh-cn: 美国国会的上议院，曾通过命名“刘晓波广场”的提案。
description.en: The upper chamber of the United States Congress, which passed the proposal to name 'Liu Xiaobo Plaza'.

description.zh-cn: 一项由美国参议院通过的，将中国驻美国大使馆门前地址改名的提案，但最终被时任总统奥巴马否决。
description.en: A proposal passed by the U.S. Senate to rename the address in front of the Chinese Embassy, which was ultimately vetoed by then-President Obama.

description.zh-cn: 美国前总统，其政府否决了“刘晓波广场”决议案。
description.en: Former President of the United States whose administration vetoed the 'Liu Xiaobo Plaza' resolution.

description.zh-cn: 美国的立法机构。其议员曾提出将中国驻华盛顿大使馆外的街道改名为“李文亮广场”。
description.en: The legislative branch of the United States government. Its members proposed renaming the street outside the Chinese embassy in Washington to 'Li Wenliang Plaza'.

description.zh-cn: 一项由美国国会议员提出的，将中国驻美大使馆外街道改名的议案，旨在纪念李文亮医生。
description.en: A bill proposed by U.S. members of Congress to rename the street outside the Chinese Embassy in the U.S. to commemorate Dr. Li Wenliang.

description.zh-cn: 中国医生，因其在2019冠状病毒病疫情早期的预警行为被誉为“吹哨人”。
description.en: A Chinese doctor, hailed as a 'whistleblower' for his early warnings about the COVID-19 outbreak.

description.zh-cn: 李文亮的遗孀，公开反对美国国会议员提出的“李文亮广场”议案。
description.en: The widow of Li Wenliang, who publicly opposed the 'Li Wenliang Plaza' bill proposed by U.S. members of Congress.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling political party of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中国驻休斯敦总领事馆

zh-cn: 中国驻休斯敦总领事馆
en: Consulate-General of the People's Republic of China, Houston

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国曾在美国休斯敦设立的总领事馆，于2020年7月被美国政府要求关闭。
description.en: The former Consulate General of the People's Republic of China in Houston, USA, which was ordered to close by the U.S. government in July 2020.

en: Consulate General of the United States, Chengdu

description.zh-cn: 美国曾在中国成都设立的总领事馆，于2020年7月被中国政府要求关闭，作为对美国关闭中国驻休斯敦总领事馆的报复措施。
description.en: The former Consulate General of the United States in Chengdu, China, which was ordered to close by the Chinese government in July 2020 in retaliation for the U.S. closure of the Chinese Consulate General in Houston.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国外交官，曾任中国驻休斯敦总领事。
description.en: A diplomat of the People's Republic of China, who served as the Consul General in Houston.

description.zh-cn: 一名佛罗里达州居民，于2023年9月试图用爆炸物袭击中国驻美大使馆未遂。
description.en: A resident of Florida who attempted to attack the Chinese Embassy in the U.S. with explosives in September 2023.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国联络处

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国联络处
en: Liaison Office of the People's Republic of China in the United States of America

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国大使馆的前身机构，在两国正式建交前运作。
description.en: The predecessor to the Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States of America, operating before the formal establishment of diplomatic relations.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国大使馆
relationships.target: 中华人民共和国外交部

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国大使馆是中华人民共和国外交部下属的驻外机构。
description.en: The Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States of America is a foreign mission subordinate to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国

description.zh-cn: 美国总统吉米·卡特宣布与中华人民共和国建立外交关系。
description.en: U.S. President Jimmy Carter announced the establishment of diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China.

relationships.target: 中华民国

description.zh-cn: 美国政府承认中华人民共和国，并与中华民国断交，导致中华民国政府撤离其驻美大使馆。
description.en: The U.S. government recognized the People's Republic of China and severed diplomatic relations with the Republic of China, forcing the ROC government to vacate its embassy in the U.S.

relationships.target: 自由中国之友协会

description.zh-cn: 在美国与中华人民共和国建交后，中华民国政府将原双橡园大使官邸以象征性低价出售给自由中国之友协会。
description.en: After the U.S. established diplomatic relations with the PRC, the government of the Republic of China sold the former Twin Oaks ambassadorial residence to the Friends of Free China Association for a symbolic low price.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国大使馆

description.zh-cn: 贝聿铭设计了中华人民共和国驻美国大使馆的新馆舍，该馆舍于2006年落成。
description.en: I. M. Pei designed the new building for the Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States, which was completed in 2006.

relationships.target: 刘晓波路

description.zh-cn: 哥伦比亚特区议会议长Phil Mendelson提案建议将中国驻美大使馆前街道命名为“刘晓波路”。
description.en: Council of the District of Columbia Chairman Phil Mendelson proposed a bill to name the street in front of the Chinese Embassy 'Liu Xiaobo Road'.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国

description.zh-cn: 命名“刘晓波路”的提案引起中华人民共和国外交部的不满，称其为“挑衅行为”。
description.en: The proposal to name 'Liu Xiaobo Road' drew dissatisfaction from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China, which called it a 'provocative act'.

relationships.target: 刘晓波广场

description.zh-cn: 美国参议院通过了将中国驻美大使馆门前地址命名为“刘晓波广场”的提案。
description.en: The U.S. Senate passed a proposal to name the address in front of the Chinese Embassy in the U.S. as 'Liu Xiaobo Plaza'.

relationships.target: 刘晓波广场

description.zh-cn: 时任美国总统奥巴马的政府表示将否决“刘晓波广场”决议案。
description.en: The administration of then-U.S. President Obama stated it would veto the 'Liu Xiaobo Plaza' resolution.

relationships.target: 李文亮广场

description.zh-cn: 数位美国国会议员提出一项议案，要求将中国驻华盛顿大使馆外的街道改名为“李文亮广场”。
description.en: Several U.S. members of Congress introduced a bill to rename the street outside the Chinese embassy in Washington to 'Li Wenliang Plaza'.

relationships.target: 李文亮广场

description.zh-cn: 李文亮的遗孀付雪洁发表声明，反对此议案，不希望有人借其名义伤害他的祖国。
description.en: Li Wenliang's widow, Fu Xuejie, issued a statement opposing the bill, not wanting anyone to harm his motherland in his name.

relationships.target: 中国共产党

description.zh-cn: 根据其遗孀付雪洁的声明，李文亮是一名中国共产党党员。
description.en: According to the statement by his widow Fu Xuejie, Li Wenliang was a member of the Communist Party of China.

relationships.target: 中国驻休斯敦总领事馆

description.zh-cn: 美国政府要求中国在72小时内关闭其驻休斯敦总领事馆。
description.en: The U.S. government ordered China to close its consulate in Houston within 72 hours.

relationships.target: 美国驻成都总领事馆

description.zh-cn: 作为对等报复措施，中国外交部通知美方关闭美国驻成都总领事馆。
description.en: As a reciprocal measure, the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs notified the U.S. side to close its Consulate General in Chengdu.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国大使馆
relationships.target: 中国驻休斯敦总领事馆

description.zh-cn: 在中国驻休斯敦总领事馆被关闭后，其原有领区由中国驻美大使馆直接管辖。
description.en: After the Consulate-General of China in Houston was closed, its original consular district was placed under the direct jurisdiction of the Chinese Embassy in the U.S.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国驻美利坚合众国大使馆

description.zh-cn: 名为Rodriguez的佛罗里达州居民试图用爆炸物袭击中国驻美大使馆墙壁未遂。
description.en: A Florida resident named Rodriguez attempted unsuccessfully to attack the wall of the Chinese Embassy in the U.S. with explosives.
